Course Section: GERN_V 101-201 - Learning German 1
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Meant for absolute beginners, this small and experiential workshop-style 3-credit course introduces students to the sounds, shapes, pleasures, and unique features involved in beginning to use the German language. Cultural topics include: Germanophone countries, gender and non-binary identities, German colonialism and ethnic diversity, Indigenous land acknowledgement in German and more.

Textbook: Sag Mal, chapters 1-3. 3rd Edition.

Sample syllabus for GERN 101 here.

Interested in other courses within the Department of Central, Eastern and Northern European Studies? Click here.

Course Section: GERN_V 102-201 - Learning German 2
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Meant for students who have completed GERN 101 (or one year of high-school German), this 3-credit class helps students speak articulately about past experiences and future plans. Cultural aspects focus on multicultural Germanophone societies, including topics such as divers foods, coffeehouses, diversity and diaspora, housing and living arrangements, multicultural holidays, fashion, and history of flags.

Textbook: Sag Mal, chapters 4-6. 

Sample syllabus for GERN 102 here.

Interested in other courses within the Department of Central, Eastern and Northern European Studies? Click here.

Course Section: GREK_V 102-001 - Beginning Ancient Greek II
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Beginning Ancient Greek II. Visit amne.ubc.ca for full course descriptions.

If the course is full or blocked, or if you do not meet restrictions for the available seats, please register for the waitlist. Students will be moved manually from the waitlist into the course section in order of registration. If the course is blocked but showing available seats, this is normal and means that waitlist transfer have not yet taken place. Email amne.undergrad@ubc.ca with any questions.

Course Section: GRSJ_V 101-201 - Introduction to Social Justice
GRSJ_V 101-227 - Introduction to Social Justice
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Law & Society stream,   
https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/law-society/. Students must register in both Term  
1 and Term 2 courses in CAP. 

This course is clustered with POLI_V 101-099, and the Law & Society sections of the CAP stream seminar CAP_V 101. For POLI_V 101-099, please register in both the lecture, and one of the following discussion sections: POLI_V 101-LZ1, POLI_V 101-LZ2, POLI_V 101-LZ3, POLI_V 101-LZ4, POLI_V 101-LZ5, or POLI_V 101-LZ6. For CAP_V 101, please register in one of the following: CAP_V 101-L01, CAP_V 101-L02, CAP_V 101-L03, or CAP_V 101-L04. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2) each term. 
 
For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/ 
 
If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

Course Section: GRSJ_V 101-99C - Introduction to Social Justice
GRSJ_V 102-201 - Global Issues in Social Justice
HIST_V 105-B_201 - Contemporary Global Issues (B)
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
In 2024W, HIST105B The Global War on Terror: A History
This course relays a history of the varied conflicts, moral and legal issues, and ideological positions that make up the nebulous, ongoing 'Global War on Terror' (GWOT). Beyond exploring the 'big' players and issues, we will undertake three more significant tasks. First, we will examine local contexts to investigate the GWOT's impact on diverse communities and individuals, seeing how they have experienced, contributed to and/or resisted the GWOT. Second, we will examine how the GWOT has helped create a politics of fear that permeates our world and inculcate suspicion of certain racialized communities. Finally, we will grapple with how diverse actors have confronted and/or resisted this politics of fear.

Course Section: HIST_V 105-B_L01 - Contemporary Global Issues (B)
Course Section Definition Public Notes: War on Terror - A Global History
